thread.title: College football: Big Sky co-leader Southern Utah visits UC Davis
thread.title_full: College football: Big Sky co-leader Southern Utah visits UC Davis | The Salt Lake Tribune

title: College football: Big Sky co-leader Southern Utah visits UC Davis
text:
Cedar City • Southern Utah, one of only two remaining Big Sky teams without a conference loss, attempts to stay perfect in league play Saturday night when the Thunderbirds visit UC Davis.
Southern Utah is 4-2 overall and 3-0 in the Big Sky. It shares first place with seventh-ranked Eastern Washington.
Since losing their first two games, the Thunderbirds have been unstoppable. They have consecutive wins over Northern Colorado, Brevard College, Weber State and Sacramento State. The combined margin: 173-10.
In last week's 44-0 victory over Sacramento State, senior quarterback Ammon Olsen threw for 421 yards and five touchdowns.
According to Southern Utah coach Ed Lamb, however, all the lopsided wins don't mean anything against UC Davis.
  "If we start thinking in terms of trying to win 44-0, we're likely to lose 44-0," he said. "We just have to take care of what we do on offense, defense and special teams."
Recalling the Aggies' 21-3 win over the Thunderbirds in 2013, senior defensive end James Cowser said, "I'm winless against UC Davis in my career — never beat them. They came to our home [two years ago] and smacked us. They ran it right down our throat and there was nothing we could do about it. That's a game that sticks out in my mind as a frustration."
-
Southern Utah at UC Davis
At Aggie Stadium
Kickoff • 5 p.m. MDT
TV • none
Radio • 590-AM
Records • Southern Utah 4-2, 3-0; UC Davis 1-6, 0-3
Series • UC Davis, 11-6
Last meeting • UC Davis, 21-3 (2013)
About the Thunderbirds • They have won four straight. … They are ranked 28th in this week's Football Championship Subdivision national poll. … They have scored on 21 of 23 trips into the red zone (91 percent). But they have managed only 13 touchdowns. … They lead the country in turnover margin (+11). ... They are fourth nationally in scoring defense (12.8) and 24th in total defense (317.8).
About the Aggies • They come off a 56-27 loss to Northern Colorado. … They have also lost to Hawaii (47-27) and Nevada (31-17) this season. … They defeated Northern Arizona, 38-24, for their only win. … QB Ben Scott, who has thrown for 11 touchdowns this season, was injured in the fourth quarter against Northern Colorado. His status for the SUU game is not known.
